item.title: Face to Face with President Eyring and Elder Holland
item.description: Watch this worldwide, Face to Face event featuring President Eyring and Elder Holland on March 4, 2017. Both answer questions about the process of acquiring personal, spiritual knowledge.

item.description: A Combined Relief Society Choir from Brigham Young University sing, "Come, O Thou King of Kings."

item.description: A Combined Relief Society Choir from Brigham Young University sing, "I Feel My Savior's Love."

item.description: Sister Bonnie H. Cordon's address at the General Women’s Session of the April 2017 General Conference.

item.description: Sister Carol F. McConkie's address at the General Women’s Session of the April 2017 General Conference.

item.title: Certain Women
item.description: Sister Linda K. Burton's address at the General Women’s Session of the April 2017 General Conference.

item.title: Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah
item.description: The choir and congregation sing, "Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah."

item.title: “My Peace I Leave with You”
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring's address at the General Women’s Session of the April 2017 General Conference.

item.title: My Heavenly Father Loves Me
item.description: A Combined Relief Society Choir from Brigham Young University sing, "My Heavenly Father Loves Me."

item.title: The First Integrated Branches in South Africa
item.description: In the early 1980s, members in South Africa worshipped together in spite of political and social differences by focusing on the common ground afforded by their faith in the restored gospel.

item.title: Break the Soil of Bitterness: One Woman's Quest for Healing
item.description: Julia Mavimbela experienced the difficulties of being a black woman in South Africa during the Apartheid era. Through her work to heal others and her conversion to the restored Gospel, she found peace.

item.title: Ask of God: Joseph Smith's First Vision
item.description: Short film produced for the Church History Museum depicting Joseph Smith's First Vision, including details drawn from each of Joseph Smith's accounts.

item.title: Relief Society 175 Anniversary
item.description: A message that helps women understand the purpose and mission of the Relief Society. Learn more at history.lds.org/women

item.title: Man's Search for Happiness (1986)
item.description: Answers the questions: Where did we come from? What is the purpose of life? Where do we go after death? Presents birth, life, and death in an eternal perspective. Emphasizes the importance of the family unit in God's plan.

item.title: The Mackintosh’s Story
item.description: Becky and Scott Mackintosh have loved their son as he has grown up, served a mission, come out as gay, and left the faith he was raised in. The entire family has learned to love in new, more inclusive ways.

item.title: Defenders of the Faith
item.description: Marie Madeline Cordon and her family were holding a Church service in their home in Italy when an angry mob of men gathered and began shouting for the missionaries to be brought outside. It was Marie who marched out of the house to confront the mob.

item.title: Spiritual Whirlwinds
item.description: Don’t let the whirlwinds drag you down. These are your days—to stand strong as disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Going to Grandma's
item.description: A grandmother plans to spend the day with her granddaughter, but can't get her to stay buckled in her car seat so they can leave.

item.title: Special Witness - President Nelson
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson bears his testimony about the Abrahamic covenant.

item.title: Relief Society 175 Anniversary
item.description: A message that helps women understand the purpose and mission of the Relief Society. Learn more at history.lds.org/women

item.title: Healing the Sick
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about healing the sick (D&C 42:43-48).

item.title: Castanedas: Financial Planning for Our Future
item.description: A couple describes how a self-reliance group helped them begin preparing for the future.

item.title: Tamisha: Finding a Better Job
item.description: A woman shares how her self-reliance group helped her find purpose and faith during a job search and career transition.

item.title: Curtis and Pshaunda: Making Finances Personal
item.description: A couple shares how the Personal Finances self-reliance group helped them gain financial skills and a witness that the temporal and the spiritual are one.

item.title: Merrills: Growing My Business
item.description: A couple shares how the Starting and Growing My Business self-reliance group led to greater faith and a stronger business.

item.title: Deborah: Faith and Finances
item.description: A Personal Finances participant shares how her group experience taught her the spiritual and temporal are related, and how faith mattered in her finances.

item.title: Jackson: Learning for a Lifetime
item.description: A returned missionary shares how the Education for Better Work self-reliance group helped him find direction for life after his mission.

item.title: Dispensations: The Pattern of Apostasy and Restoration
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles explains dispensations of the gospel and why this last dispensation is unique.

item.title: How to Use the Elevate Learning Experience
item.description: An in-depth training on how to use the Elevate Learning Experience questions.

item.title: We Don’t Need to Be the Same to Be One
item.description: We are different by design. Embrace the “and.”

item.title: Things That Matter Most
item.description: “We would do well... to lift up our eyes, and truly see the things that matter most.” - President Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Ask of God: Joseph Smith's First Vision
item.description: Short film produced for the Church History Museum depicting Joseph Smith's First Vision, including details drawn from each of Joseph Smith's accounts.

item.title: We Don’t Need to Be the Same to Be One
item.description: We are different by design. Embrace the “and.”

item.title: The Prince of Peace: Find Lasting Peace through Jesus Christ
item.description: Find peace in a troubled world by learning more of Jesus Christ. This Easter season, learn principles of peace from the #PRINCEofPEACE. Get started at mormon.org.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Forgiveness #PrinceofPeace
item.description: It’s impossible to find lasting peace without forgiving and being forgiven. We’ve all been wronged by others and have made mistakes of our own, but that doesn’t mean we can’t find peace by turning to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Faith #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Many people, if they were given only 15 months to live, would sink into despair. But through her faith in Jesus Christ, Kristin found the strength to carry on. Learn how her faith helped her to trust in God’s plan for her family.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Hope #PrinceofPeace
item.description: One of the greatest blessings of following Jesus Christ is the knowledge that we can be with our loved ones again after death. This knowledge can give us the hope we need to get through our darkest times.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Gratitude #PrinceofPeace
item.description: We can show gratitude by being thankful for all that Jesus Christ has made possible in our lives. Jon’s upbringing could have made him focus on what his life lacked. However, he chose instead to dwell on all the wonderful things he had.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Compassion #PrinceofPeace
item.description: The greatest example of service is Jesus Christ, who gave freely of Himself without any thought of reward. When we follow His example by serving others, we can discover peace even amid turmoil in our lives.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Repentance #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Thanks to the sacrifice of Jesus Christ, we all have the ability to repent—to be free from the guilt and burden of our past sins. Learn how Melody put her past behind her with Jesus’s help and was able to find peace in her new life.

item.title: Principles of Peace: God’s Word #PrinceofPeace
item.description: When we read about Christ and study His words, we find His example and teachings to follow. This understanding can bring us the peace we seek in our lives. Learn how Amelia found peace through searching the word of God.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Prayer #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Prayer is how we tell our Heavenly Father the blessings we desire and express our gratitude for what He has given us. As we pray in the name of Jesus Christ, we can receive answers to our prayers—including finding the peace Christ promises us.

item.title: Leadership Session at RootsTech 2017: Elders Steven E. Snow and Bradley D. Foster
item.description: Elder Foster and Elder Snow share the vision and joy of participating in the plan of salvation.

item.title: Leadership Session at RootsTech 2017: Elder Dale G. Renlund
item.description: Elder Renlund teaches about the blessings of family history for new converts to the church.

item.title: Leadership Session at RootsTech 2017: Elder M. Russell Ballard
item.description: Elder Ballard shares the importance of Temple and Family History Service.

item.title: Leadership Session at RootsTech 2017: Elder Quentin L. Cook
item.description: Elder Cook shares the importance of Temple and Family History Service.

item.title: Ask of God: Joseph Smith's First Vision
item.description: Short film produced for the Church History Museum depicting Joseph Smith's First Vision, including details drawn from each of Joseph Smith's accounts.

item.title: Alan's Story
item.description: As a young bishop Alan had to deal with the challenge of understanding the dark power of depression. After going through depression himself he learns how to bring back the light in his life and receive strength from the lord.

item.title: Alek's Story
item.description: Alek struggled as a youth and on his mission with depression and anxiety. It was the love of his family that helped him see how he could apply the Atonement and find hope.

item.title: Cassidy's Story
item.description: Cassidy began experiencing symptoms of bipolar disorder at 16. Eventually, she gained the desire to be happy again and to understand what was happening became more important than anything. So she reached out for help.

item.title: Jesslyn's Story
item.description: Jesslyn felt surrounded by darkness during her youth and began struggling even more after returning from her mission. She finally decided to hope for hope and to try everything she could, even if it was just for one more day.

item.title: Jessyca's Story
item.description: Jessyca lived in an abusive home as a child and developed post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) as a result. When it became difficult to get out of bed each day, she began to recognize the seriousness of her condition.

item.title: Lisa's Story
item.description: Lisa worried that a diagnosis of bipolar disorder would cause people to see or treat her differently. When she determined to find herself again, she found a source of comfort and learned that she didn’t have to be a victim of her illness.

item.title: Melinda's Story
item.description: Melinda’s husband dealt with depression in secret for many years before taking his own life. She shares her story of dealing with depression and the experience of learning how to over come it.

item.title: Sheina's Story
item.description: Sheina describes her experience with depression as feeling like a bird trapped in a cage. Listen to Sheina’s story of recovery and faith through ongoing challenges.

item.title: Alan's Story
item.description: As a young bishop Alan had to deal with the challenge of understanding the dark power of depression. After going through depression himself he learns how to bring back the light in his life and receive strength from the lord.

item.title: Avoid Distracted Driving
item.description: Distractions can lead to dangerous conditions on the road; drivers need to focus while they drive.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Makeup
item.description: Simple things like doing makeup while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Music
item.description: Simple things like getting into your music while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Phone Call
item.description: Simple things like talking on the phone while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Food
item.description: Simple things like eating while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.
